title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.16-17 Part 1 | 08-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: They just gave up and went to receive Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses to be discussed, focusing on the happiness of Krishna's family upon his return to Dwaraka and their eagerness to receive him.

segments.key_quote: So, all the eight daughters of Devaka, Ugrasena's brother, were married by Vasudeva.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to describe the personalities mentioned in the verses, starting with Vasudeva, detailing his lineage, marriages, and relationship to Krishna and other important figures.

segments.key_quote: This is called Krishna Leela, actually.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Vasudeva and Devaki, focusing on Kamsa's attempts to kill Krishna, the transfer of Balaram to Rohini's womb, and Krishna's eventual birth and transfer to Gokula.

segments.key_quote: We should hear from the scriptures. The divine nature of all of Krishna's activities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the divine nature of Krishna's activities and the importance of understanding them through scripture, continuing with Vasudeva's role as the maternal uncle of the Pandavas and his eventual disappearance.

segments.key_quote: Akrura is famous for having offered wonderful prayers to Krishna and perfected his devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker transitions to describing Akrura, highlighting his devotion to Krishna and his fame for perfecting devotional service through prayer.

segments.key_quote: Bhakti is so nice, simply by hearing about Krishna, simply by singing Krishna's glory, simply by offering prayers to Krishna or simply by remembering Krishna's pastimes, one can achieve all.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the power of bhakti and continues describing Akrura's role in Krishna's pastimes, including his support of Arjuna's marriage to Subhadra and his presence at Abhimanyu's wedding.
